hackathon-eligibility: This is a community event, anyone intersted in improving Baltimore City Schools can enter. You are expected to work in teams, which can be built out further after the event.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Selected projects will receive seed funding, based on their proposed budgets, from Baltimore City Public Schools. Funding will likely not exceed $2,500 per project. There is no strict limit on the number of projects that will be selected for funding.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Baltimore Design School, 1500 Barclay Street, Baltimore, MD 21202, USA
hackathon-location-address: Baltimore Design School, 1500 Barclay Street, Baltimore, MD 21202, USA
hackathon-description-header: It’s time to do better for Baltimore City Public School students. It starts with getting them to school.Smarter Schools Challenge: Transit invites Baltimoreans to creatively improve student transit.
